revised_title: Chemical Composition of Shell and Bone
tldr: The author, Charles Hatchett, conducted experiments on the chemical composition of shells and bones, specifically examining marine shells and bones of various animals. He discovered that shells are primarily composed of carbonate of lime, while bones contain a larger portion of a more viscous gelatinous substance. Hatchett also observed that shells composed of nacre or mother of pearl have a layered structure with each layer being a membrane coated with a layer of carbonate of lime. This research helped to understand the composition and formation of shells and bones.
